Quotations.ab: u-š frastuiiē bun bē kunišn tā staōmi aṣ̌əm frāz gōwišn u-š pad staōmi pāy ī dašn andar gāh ī zōtān nihišn u-š aṣ̌əm vohū ī dudīgar ī barsom gōwišn ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay hād staōmi aṣ̌əm ka nē pad barsom gōwēd ā nē šāyēd ka-š nē ranjagīhā ā-š abestāg hamāg az pāy gōwišn ka-š be vasasca tū ahura mazda ud aməṣ̌a spəṇta ka-š ranjagīhā ēn and az pāy gōwišn bišāmrūd ud srīšāmrūt ud cahrušāmrūd ud šnūman wizārišnīh ud wāz gīrišnīh ud srōš barišnīh az yašt bun tā imat̰ barəsma haδa zaōθrəm az ahurāi mazdāi tā daθušō ud az aētat̰ dim tā ān yašt sar hādān sar hamāg tā vaŋhucā vaŋhā̊scā abestāg pad ranjagīhātar ka nišīnān gōwēd nē tarmenišnīhā

"He has to begin the frastuiiē and to recite up to staōmi aṣ̌əm At staōmi, he has to put his right food on the zōtgāh and recite the second Aṣ̌əm Vohū of the barsom. There is one commentator who says that, if he does not recite staōmi aṣ̌əm in the proximity of the barsom, then it is not allowed." "If (he can do it) without trouble, he should recite the Avestan texts standing up, except for vasasca tū ahura mazda and aməṣ̌a spəṇta. If (standing up) is troublesome for him, he should recite the following texts standing up: the passages to be recited twice, three times, and four times; the recitation of the šnūmans; the taking of the bāj; and the srōš-barišnīh from the beginning of the service up to imat̰ barəsma haδa zaōθrəm; from ahurāi mazdāi up to daθušō; and from aētat̰ dim up to the end of that act of worship the end of the sections: all the Avestan up to vaŋhucā vaŋhā̊scā. If it is even more troublesome (for the priest), it is not disrespectful if he recites (everything) sitting down."

ModernPractice.ab: "The chief priest and the assistant priest both joining the hands, putting the big toe of their right foot on the big toe of the left foot, recite aloud frastuiie ... aṣ̌əm vohū (Y0.9)."
